Course Section Definition Public Notes:
The prerequisites for this course are:
Both of (a) CPSC 320 and (b) one of STAT 200, STAT 241, STAT 302, or any course credit-excluded with one of these STAT courses in the UBC Science Credit Exclusion list.

It is possible to receive credit for up to two CPSC 436 offerings that are different courses, i.e., those with different letters after the 436 number. Students may not receive credit for the same CPSC 436 offering more than once. Similarly, if a CPSC 436 offering later transitions to a regular course number, students may not receive credit for that offering and the subsequent course. Students wishing to receive credit for more than two CPSC 436 offerings must appeal for permission.

The prerequisite for this course is all of: CPSC 313 and CPSC 317.

Permission of the department to register is automatically granted if you meet the prerequisite listed above. Please do not request permission.

Students wishing to receive credit for more than two CPSC 436 offerings must appeal for permission
Discussions are optional. Registering in this section indicates your choice not to have a reserved seat in any other Discussion section.

Course Section Definition Public Notes:
For more information including application details, please see the following link:
https://www.cs.ubc.ca/students/undergrad/courses/specialty

The Interactive Digital Media Practicum Course is by application only.

To apply:
(1) Register for the waitlist section for the offering you want to join.
(2) Apply for the course (and learn more about it) at https://thecdm.ca/program/ubc-sfu-digital-media-practicum

Applications are due at 11:59PM (Vancouver time) on October 25 for Jan-Apr offerings and March 11 for May-Aug offerings. (When the deadline is a weekend/holiday, applications are due at 11:59PM on the next business day.)

If you are unable to register for the waitlist because of credit limit issues--e.g., arranging backup courses in case you are not accepted to the practicum--please apply at the website listed above and document your reasons for being unable to register for the waitlist.

CSIS_V 450-B_201 - Topics in Critical Studies in Sexuality (B)
Course Section Definition Public Notes:
Special Topics Title: Performing Gender and Sexuality with Dr. Isabel Machado

Description: 
This course uses different frameworks and lenses to look at performances that defy gender normativity in different parts of the globe.
It explores how not only femininity and/or masculinity are being recreated, reaffirmed, or mocked in performances, but also ideas (and ideals) about race, class, body shapes and abilities, national and local belonging, and ethnicity.
It investigates how “drag” can simultaneously reflect, reinforce, and resist ideologies from mainstream cultures.
It will look for instances of queer joyful defiance and gender euphoria in gender-bending public performances, as well as moments in which cross-dressing served as a ritualesque means of reinforcing normativity and policing gender identities and embodiments.

CSIS 490 is available to CSIS minors and GRSJ majors with 3rd or 4th year standing. 
If you are interested in taking a Directed Readings course, please apply here: https://grsj.air.arts.ubc.ca/application-grsj-directed-studies/ (CSIS and GRSJ students only).
Registration follows completion of DES 402 and approval for the Honours Option

ECED_V 400-63D - Introduction to Early Childhood Education and Care
Course Section Definition Public Notes:
Online, asynchronous.

1) Initial registration is restricted to students in the following programs: MA or MED with specialization ECED; Diploma with specialization EYED or IDSC; Basic Certificate stream; CEYED Certificate; BA with Minor in Education and Emphasis ECED;
2) Registration will be available for all Education Diploma students on June 26, 2024, after 10am PT.
3) Registration will be available for Unclassified and all undergraduate students on July 18, 2024, after 10am PT.

Registration will be blocked when the course is full and seats will be filled from the waitlist.
A priority sequence waitlist is available for this course. For information about how ECED waitlists function, please visit https://pdce.educ.ubc.ca/online-courses.

Inquiries: online.educ@ubc.ca.
